intro: Canthium racemulosum, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, simple leaves, and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
